Fields.DialogueText: What are you doing up here all by yourself, U-30?
I'm not by myself, Kapitän - Schnuffi is here keeping me company.

Oh right, I'm always forgetting about Schnuffi - he's our boat's 
mascot, after all. You've seemed down lately, so I just wanted to check on you.
It's been difficult for me since I manifested, Kapitän. I've had a lot of things to think about. It's shameful how U-Boote have been used in the past...

Fields.MenuText: Ah, you mean how U-boats have been used to target merchant ships?
Well, it is a bit difficult for U-boats to fight under those old-fashioned cruiser rules.
Unrestricted submarine warfare is the only logical way for U-boats to fight.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. It's just not right to target innocent civilians...
That is true, Kapitän - a U-Boot is too small to send a prize crew to capture a ship, or to take on any prisoners.
It's not the only way, Kapitän. I can't imagine a savior like you even suggesting such a thing!
The honorable solution is for U-Boote to stop targeting civilians completely. It would make up for all the horrible things U-Boote have done in the past...
Maybe... but I guess we don't have to worry about any of that for now. With the Neutrality Fleet, every U-boat out there is sinking Morganas.
Ja, Kapitän - we can all agree that's a good use for all the U-Boote in the fleet. Those of us that are awake, anyway.
Hmm... well, we've got some Morganas ahead, so maybe sinking a few of them will cheer you up a little.
Perhaps, Kapitän... perhaps...
@BATTLE
You've been sitting in the shadows for the past few hours, U-30...
Isn't that what U-Boote are supposed to do, Kapitän?
Yes, but it's obvious that you're still upset about something. You're not your usual self.
Maybe I'm beyond saving, Kapitän. Those people on my targets are...
We've all made mistakes, U-30... and most of us don't have the excuse of being built for it. It breaks my heart to see you feeling so low all the time.
... do you really mean that, Kapitän? You actually care about me that much?

Fields.MenuText: Of course I care about you. You have a special place in my heart.
Yes. Fate brought us together for a reason, U-30.
Enough to wish you weren't sulking all the time...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, Kapitän! You really are my savior, aren't you?
I agree, Kapitän! You've come to save us all - from the Nixen and from our own imperfections.
I'm sorry, Kapitän. Murder is murder.
Is there anything I can do to cheer you up? We could do some fun activity that you enjoy, or maybe pick up some of your favorite food the next time we're in port?
I appreciate your concern, Kapitän. I suppose all of us U-Boote are born with an original sin of sorts - it's just part of who we are.
As for favorite activities or food... I'm not sure if I have any.
Oh, I'm sure you must have a hobby or two that could cheer you up...
Hmm... mostly sinking the Nixen... and boxing.
Well that's not a bad start. Let's try some boxing. Exercise is always a way to brighten up one's mood.
*BOOM*
Nixen, Kapitän! Gefechtsstationen!
@BATTLE
Let's start with some shadowboxing, U-30. Getting your heart pumping will surely improve your mood.
If you insist, Kapitän...
You've been in the doldrums for the last few days. I think practicing your footwork and throwing a few punches will put some wind back into your sails.
I don't have sails, Kapitän - you of all people should know that...

Fields.MenuText: It was a figure of speech, U-30...
Are you really still down on yourself about your past?
Sometimes we just need to let the past go.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I see...
The hardest thing about the past is that you can't change it, Kapitän.
Letting the past go would mean I would have to stop caring about all the harm I have done, Kapitän.
Look, U-30 - I don't know why you're acting like this, but we've got a war to fight. We can't sit around crying when there are Morganas terrorizing the oceans.
I suppose you're right, Kapitän...
Now come on - let's do some shadowboxing. I'll train alongside you. Let's start with some basic one-two combos...
I'm so tired, Kapitän - but I'll try to throw a few punches...
Yeah! There you go! One-two! One-two! Nice and snappy!
One...
*THWACK*
Two!
*BOOM*
Scheisse! What was that?
Incoming fire from Morganas! Let's dive, U-30!
I'm not in my best fighting form, Kapitän, but I would never take a dive in a match!
I'm not talking about boxing anymore, U-30! We need to get this boat under the surface before we get sunk!
@BATTLE
I'm feeling a little better after that shadowboxing session, Kapitän. Thank you.
I thought it would help, but I'm pretty sure it was torpedoing those Morganas right afterwards that really put a smile on your face.
Perhaps, Kapitän. In any case, thank you for looking out for my well-being.
I'm the boat's captain, U-30. Of course I'm looking out for you. I need you to be ready to fight. I can't have you sulking behind a bulkhead when the Morganas attack.
I understand, Kapitän. You... you really are my savior.

Fields.MenuText: I'll always be here to protect you, U-30.
I really wish you'd knock it off with all this savior business...
You're always in need of saving, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: I - I'm usually not so needy, Kapitän!
I know you're modest, Kapitän, but you don't have to deny the truth.
As a shepherd will always protect the flock, Kapitän.
Don't put all the pressure on me, though. You've got to do what you can to try and pull yourself out of this funk too.
I'll do my best to try and improve my mood, Kapitän.
Maybe Schnuffi can help... you do seem to have a completely irrational affection towards him.
It is more of an obligation than affection, Kapitän... in any case, do not underestimate Schnuffi's capabilities!
*BOOM*
Nixen, Kapitän! They're always catching us off guard lately!
At least those Morganas manage to perk you up whenever they attack. Let's get some torpedoes in the water!
@BATTLE
I have an idea, Kapitän.
What is it?
It's a way for us U-Boote to make up for all the civilian ships we've sunk in the past.
As long as it involves destroying Morganas, then I'm all ears.
Natürlich, Kapitän.
So what's the idea?
The advantage of the U-Boot is our ability to strike from a concealed position. This is what has allowed us to hunt and destroy merchant ships in the past.
Right - but with the Neutrality Fleet agreement, Morganas are the only things threatening civilian ships.
Ja, Kapitän. At the same time, we have been repeatedly surprised by attacks from the Nixen lately. It's quite embarrassing for a U-Boot to be ambushed like this.
That's true. So what are you proposing?
We find a merchant ship to use as bait to attract the Nixen, then hit those Nixen from below when they least expect it!

Fields.MenuText: Ah, like feinting a jab and then landing an uppercut?
That's really sneaky - not surprising coming from a U-boat.
It's dirty and underhanded. I like it.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly! I'm glad you've absorbed some of my boxing knowledge.
This is exactly the reputation I am trying to correct, Kapitän!
There is nothing dishonorable in deceiving the Nixen, Kapitän.
Well, as long as it helps us stop getting ambushed by the Morganas, it sounds like a good plan to me.
I'm glad you agree, Kapitän. Now all we must do is find a civilian ship that will collaborate with us.
I'm not sure where we'll find a civilian captain that brave - but we'll have to take care of these Morganas ahead of us first.
@BATTLE
You've finally got a smile on your face, U-30!
Ja, Kapitän! I shall soon repent for the sins of my past by sinking all of the Nixen in the North Sea.
That's a pretty lofty goal. How are you going to manage that?
The plan I told you about the other day, Kapitän - we will use a merchant ship to lure in the Nixen, then surprise them with a knockout blow from below the surface.
Oh right, that plan of yours - but it's going to be impossible to find a civilian captain willing to use his ship as bait. The Morganas have already sunk tons of merchant ships in the North Sea...
Ah, but I have just found a civilian Kapitän in this port willing to volunteer his ship and crew for this mission!

Fields.MenuText: Is he insane? The Morganas have been sinking merchant ships all over the North Sea.
Did you have to use any "persuasive methods" to convince him to help?
Did he ask his crew how they felt about the idea?

Fields.DialogueText: He trusts us, Kapitän. I told him that you'll be the savior of us all.
I'm not sure why you're using that tone of voice, Kapitän - but I told him about how you will be the savior of all the ships at sea.
Nein, but the Kapitän insists the crew is loyal! I also assured him that no harm will come to any of them - you are the savior, after all.
I'm barely comfortable with you calling me a savior, but I absolutely can't support you trying to convince other people of it!
Why do you doubt yourself, Kapitän? Have we not triumphed over every evil creature we have faced? Have we not accomplished more than any typical Kapitän and Boot could ever hope to achieve together?
I think the constant pressure changes from all your diving are starting to affect your thinking...
*ALARM*
We've got Morganas in the harbor, U-30. We'll have to talk more about your plan later.
Jawohl, Kapitän! You will certainly be impressed by the Kapitän and ship I found to support our plan!
It's "your" plan, not "ours," U-30. Let's get out there and clear this harbor...
Why do you doubt me, Kapitän? I never doubt you!
@BATTLE
You've got to be kidding me, U-30!
Why would I do that, Kapitän? U-Boote are not really the joking type...
You're telling me that the only ship you could find willing to act as bait for the Morganas in this plan of yours happens to be fully loaded with Allied air force bombs?
Well... that is only partially true, Kapitän...
Partially true?
Ja... the ship is not just transporting air force bombs. It also has artillery shells for the army and a few torpedoes for the navy.

Fields.MenuText: You're already putting a ship at risk - and now you're adding explosives to the mix?
I don't know who's more foolish - you or the captain of that ship.
You understand I'll be held liable if anything goes wrong, right?

Fields.DialogueText: The munitions are perfectly safe as long as we ensure the ship takes no damage, Kapitän.
The Kapitän did smelly slightly of whiskey when I spoke with him - but he was otherwise quite lucid.
How could they hold our savior liable for anything? In any case, nothing will go wrong, so you don't need to worry.
This sounds like a terrible idea, U-30. One lucky hit from a Morgana could blow that merchant ship to smithereens!
You don't like my clever idea to destroy the Nixen, Kapitän? Well, if you don't want to do it... I suppose I could go back to sulking behind the bulkhead...
Are you trying to use emotional manipulation against me to get what you want?
I would never... ever... do such a thing to you, Kapitän! You are my savior, after all.
*GUNFIRE*
Blast! We'll take care of these Morganas first, then we'll talk more about this plan of yours!
@BATTLE
So that's the merchant ship you want to use as bait for the Morganas?
Ja - she's quite a beautiful ship, is she not, Kapitän?
I couldn't care less how she looks. She's also got tons of explosive munitions in her hold, right?
These are small details, Kapitän. It was difficult to find a merchant Kapitän willing to volunteer their ship for such a heroic task.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't "heroic task" a code phrase for "suicide mission?"
The captain also smells like whiskey 24 hours a day, doesn't he?
What is the merchant ship and her crew getting out of this anyway?

Fields.DialogueText: That's nonsense, Kapitän! Would a shepherd as noble and wise as you ever lose a sheep in your flock?
Well... 24 hours a day is a bit of an exaggeration, Kapitän! There must be a few hours a day when he doesn't smell too bad - perhaps when he's asleep?
They hate the Nixen as much as every other merchant crew on the ocean, Kapitän.
The ship's crew has sailed with many other ships that were sunk by the Nixen. They want their revenge, Kapitän - and we're providing them with a fantastic opportunity.
We're also providing them with a fantastic opportunity to get blown to kingdom come if any of the munitions in their hold catch fire.
You worry too much, Kapitän.
I'm a U-boat captain - it's my job to worry.
You do your job well, Kapitän.
*GUNFIRE*
Morganas! Keep them away from that merchant ship!
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
The Kapitän of the merchant ship sends his thanks for letting his ship participate in our patrol against the Nixen.
Let's see if he still thanks me by the end of this patrol.
Of course he will, Kapitän - aren't we always thankful for the saviors in our lives?
I'm not sure he shares the same belief system as you do, U-30 - at least when it concerns me. By the way - what's the name of this ship and captain?
His name is Kapitän Brenner, and the ship's name is the Firestorm.

Fields.MenuText: Doesn't "Brenner" mean "to burn" in German?
So the name of the ship full of munitions that we're using as bait is "Firestorm?"
Are we tempting fate?

Fields.DialogueText: Fate brought us together, Kapitän, so I only expect good fortune to come out of our relationship!
Ja, it can refer to fire... or someone who makes very strong alcohol.
That is a bit of an odd name for a merchant ship, isn't it?
Right. So Captain Brenner is really committed to sailing an entire patrol with us, just to attract Morganas for us to ambush?
He gave his word, Kapitän.
Well... I guess we'll have to give it a shot. Tell him to sail his ship out front, and we can dive and follow him.
Ja, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
It's working as planned, Kapitän!
The Morganas are sailing towards the Firestorm?
Ja, Kapitän - and meanwhile, we can stalk the Nixen from below until we get close enough to strike!

Fields.MenuText: We just need to make sure we sink the Morganas before they get too close to the Firestorm.
Your plan is actually working, U-30!

Fields.DialogueText: Did you have such little faith in my plan, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Do you feel this is redeeming your past?

Fields.DialogueText: Well... I can't change the past, Kapitän - but I can try to make up for it.
Have I ever had trouble sinking the Nixen, Kapitän?
Good point.
I'm glad you feel that way.
You have to admit there are still a lot of things that could go wrong...
We've attracted a sizable fleet of Nixen, Kapitän.
It'll be a challenge taking out so many of them in a short period of time. If only one of them gets in a lucky shot on the Firestorm, then it's not going to be pretty.
Let's sail a little closer then, Kapitän.
... We're just getting into range.
Arming the torpedoes, Kapitän!
Throw your sucker punch whenever you're ready, U-30.
You make my artful deception sound so crude, Kapitän!
You can call it whatever you want as long as you sink those Morganas before they get lucky!
@BATTLE
Please say it again, Kapitän - I enjoy hearing your voice.
I said that I'm happy that everything worked out exactly as you had planned.
Vielen Dank, Kapitän! We've only started our patrol, so I'm sure we will catch many more Nixen with the help of the Firestorm and Kapitän Brenner.
I hope so - but it's stressful being responsible for the safety of a civilian ship that can't even defend itself.
You are our good shepherd, Kapitän. Any member of your flock is as safe as the others.

Fields.MenuText: I don't mind commanding a fleet where everyone has guns.
Civilians are a liability when the fighting starts.
If the munitions in that merchant ship blow, there's a chance it'll sink us too.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't forget the Torpedos, Kapitän! Striking from the shadows is our biggest advantage.
Even civilians have the instincts to protect themselves when in danger, Kapitän.
You can't go into the fight with those kinds of thoughts, Kapitän. A loser's mentality will surely result in getting knocked out.
The Morganas we've encountered so far haven't been that difficult. I'm worried what will happen when we attract stronger ones.
Don't worry. We'll knock out any Nixe that steps into the ring to challenge us, Kapitän.
I just hope they don't land any solid punches on the Firestorm. That ship is a huge accident waiting to happen...
*BOOM*
Morganas! We've got to keep them away from the Firestorm!
Ja, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
I guess there are some advantages to sailing alongside a merchant ship loaded with munitions...
Ja, Kapitän. Evidently so.
Where is the Firestorm headed with all these munitions?
She's on her way to Portsmouth.
Aren't we holding her up, then? I'm sure her supplies are needed for the war.
Kapitän Brenner is more concerned about fighting the Nixen than helping with the land war, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, why's that?

Fields.DialogueText: He's seen far too many of his fellow merchant ships sunk by the Nixen. He would rather support Neutrality Fleet efforts to defeat the Nixen instead of helping armies kill each other in the land war.
That's understandable - and quite noble of him to place his ship and crew at risk.
One has to take risks to accomplish anything worthwhile, Kapitän.
That is true - I took a risk with you, after all.
I'm glad you did, Kapitän--
*GUNFIRE*
Nixen approaching, Kapitän!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I can't tell you how happy stories like that make the OKM.

Fields.DialogueText: Sarkasmus?
Oh, yes.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I'll take all the help I can get.

Fields.DialogueText: He's a man of the sea, though.
I've been meaning to ask you something, U-30...
What is it, Kapitän?
Where did you find Schnuffi, anyway? He was a stray, right?
Oh... well, yes...
Right. So where did you find him?
It was... shortly after I awakened, Kapitän. I found Schnuffi... in the water.

Fields.MenuText: You found Schnuffi in the water?
Dogs can swim, but you usually find them on land.
Was he under water or on the surface?

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän - no need to repeat what I have already said.
Of course, Kapitän. Schnuffi is a dog, not a sea lion.
On the surface, of course! Schnuffi only dives when he's with me inside a U-Boot, Kapitän.
So why exactly was a dog floating in the middle of the ocean?
Well... if you must know... there was a passenger ship that sank shortly after I awoke. The first thing I remember hearing was the sound of people drowning...
I'm sorry... that must have been terrible...
It was more terrible for the men and women in the water, I assure you. We didn't have room to save any of them - but Schnuffi managed to paddle his way over to my deck.
I can see why Schnuffi means so much to you now. I have to apologize for poking fun at him all this time.
Schnuffi is a survivor - just like me, Kapitän.
*BOOM*
Depth charges! Must be Morganas ahead!
@BATTLE
How have Captain Brenner and his crew on the Firestorm been doing?
He remains motivated, and the crew's morale is high, Kapitän.
That's good to hear. They've have a lot of close calls with the Morganas already. Good to know they're not scared of all the gunfire.
Quite the opposite, Kapitän! The crew cheers whenever they manage to lure in a Nixe and we sink her from below.

Fields.MenuText: I have to admit that this strategy is working.
Good to hear that they remain fearless in the face of danger.
I'm still worried about how vulnerable the Firestorm is.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän! The Nixen cannot resist the temptation of a lone merchant ship in the middle of the sea. They are drawn in close, where we can punch through their hulls from below!
Civilians can be as brave as sailors on warships, Kapitän - perhaps braver without any weapons to defend themselves.
We must make sure we take out all Nixe threats before they get close enough to harm the Firestorm. Don't worry, Kapitän - we are keeping watch.
As brave as they are, we still have the obligation to protect that ship at all costs.
Ja, Kapitän - losing them would be unacceptable.
This method of yours is working though - we've managed to sink twice as many Morganas in half the time compared to our usual patrols.
I told you my goal was to sink every Nixe in the North Sea, Kapitän.
Well, we're coming up on a few more, so arm the torpedoes!
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
I'm glad you've been feeling better on this patrol, U-30.
I apologize for being so down a while ago. Sometimes I get into these moods, and I think about everything I've done wrong in life...
It's normal for everyone to go through periods like that. I really admire you, so it's a shame when you feel so bad about yourself.
You admire me, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Of course! You punched a Vanity to the bottom of the sea on our last patrol!
You've got a heart of gold to care for Schnuffi like you do.
You've got some pretty long legs for a U-boat...

Fields.DialogueText: Those Nixen don't know how to take a punch, Kapitän!
Schnuffi has had a hard life, Kapitän. All he deserves is to live his life in peace.
We are quite limited by fuel capacity, Kapitän - but we make up for it with our lethality in combat.
Well, keep up the good work. You're doing a hell of a lot to fight those Morganas and support the war effort.
I appreciate your praise, Kapitän!
Schnuffi's been doing a great job too... at, uh... being a motivational mascot for the boat.
Most of the crew just kick him out of the way, Kapitän. That's why he's always hiding behind the pipes now.
Well, it is pretty cramped down there... but I'll have a word with everyone and tell them to give Schnuffi the respect he deserves.
Vielen Dank, Kapitän.
Oh, I see some Morganas approaching - let's dive and hit them before they get too close to the Firestorm.
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
Care to slip on the boxing gloves and squeeze in a round of sparring now that there are no Morganas around?
That sounds like fun, Kapitän!
I'm glad you're smiling a lot more these days, U-30.
Working with Kapitän Brenner and the Firestorm to lure in Nixen to sink has really lifted my spirits, Kapitän!
Well, you're doing what you were born to do, U-30 - and that's sink enemy ships.
Sink enemy ships... yes, Kapitän... it's always good to sink the enemy...

Fields.MenuText: Why are you acting so strangely all of a sudden?
Of course you sink enemy ships. Who else would you sink?
Are you worried about something?

Fields.DialogueText: Me? I'm not acting strange at all, Kapitän. Perhaps you are the one acting strange...
Oh, to think otherwise is a ridiculous thought, isn't it, Kapitän?
I'm not one to worry unnecessarily, Kapitän - you know that.
Well, okay... maybe you just need some boxing to clear your head.
Ja, boxing always helps me focus, Kapitän!
Just remember to pull your punches when we're sparring - you're a thousand times stronger than I am, and my jaw has never been the same ever since you hit me last time.
Of course, Kapitän - I admit that sometimes I forget my own strength--
--and sometimes you hit targets you didn't intended to - but my jaw's still hurting, whether it was intentional or not. Let's get started!
Ja... ja, Kapitän. Sometimes I do hit things unintentionally...
*THWACK*
Ugh! Not again! Gahhh--
Entschuldigung, Kapitän! I didn't mean to hit you that hard with a liver punch!
*BOOM*
Morganas, U-30! Help me get off this deck so we can fight!
@BATTLE
I must apologize again for that unintended liver punch, Kapitän.
You do realize you're a lot stronger than me, right? Just take it easy when we're sparring - you're already the better boxer.
I can't control myself sometimes, Kapitän. It's a bad habit of mine...
Ah, I didn't mean to make you feel bad about it. I know it was an accident. Still hurts like hell though...
We took care of those Nixen, Kapitän, so just relax and catch your breath.

Fields.MenuText: I'm trying - but it'll take a few more minutes.
At least it wasn't a head shot this time...
I think I broke a rib...

Fields.DialogueText: You should have a full medical evaluation at the next port, Kapitän.
I'll keep an eye out for any more Nixen.
Please don't remind me about the last time, Kapitän...
I'm sure I'll be well enough to get through the rest of this partrol. I just need a few more moments before I'm okay to stand up again.
*GUNFIRE*
... I should have seen that coming.
@BATTLE
I'm really impressed with how Captain Brenner and his crew have conducted themselves on this patrol.
Ja, Kapitän. They are quite brave, aren't they?
Yes. It's made me think about how important civilians are in this war against the Morganas.
Civilians play an important role in every war, Kapitän - whether they like it or not.

Fields.MenuText: The whole world needs to work together if we want to beat these Morganas.
Civilians aren't soldiers, but their actions can help win a war.
I just wish war didn't affect so many people who never asked to be a part of it.

Fields.DialogueText: The sense of self-preservation has united us all, Kapitän.
That is true, Kapitän, although I wish they weren't forced into such situations.
The ones who decide to make war are rarely the ones who suffer from its consequences.
This war with the Morganas isn't like any other war humanity has fought before. We have no idea where the Morganas came from, and it's not like we can negotiate with their leaders.
Ja, Kapitän - and every Nixe we encounter is a combatant. There are no civilian Nixen as far as we know.
No need to hold back then - we can sink every Morgana in the North Sea, just like you want to.
Ja - and there are more Nixen ahead, Kapitän! They continue to fall into our trap, lured in by the Firestorm.
Arm the torpedoes, U-30. We've got more Morganas to sink!
@BATTLE
It's been a great patrol so far, U-30. Using the Firestorm as bait has lured in dozens of Morganas for us to sink, and it's managed to get you in a much better mood.
I suppose sinking the Nixen is what I do best, Kapitän, so it always puts me in a good mood whenever we're victorious!
Yes, I think even Schnuffi has had a bit more spring in his step lately!
Ist das so, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, Schnuffi has been running around and playing a lot more whenever we're up on deck.
Schnuffi is more confident. He even barks at the crew when they're in his way.
You've given Schnuffi a lot more affection lately. He's enjoying it.

Fields.DialogueText: That is true. He's enjoying the sunshine a little more these days.
Ha! It wasn't too long ago when he hid behind the pipes and bulkheads to avoid confrontation.
I suppose that's what we all want, Kapitän - just a little confirmation that someone else cares about us.
It's the quiet moments like these up on the deck when I forget there's a war going on...
Ja, Kapitän - everything is so beautiful right now, isn't it? The way the sun shines off the water, the sound of the wind and the ocean...
I wish we could sail the world forever, you and I, just like this.
Oh Kapitän--
*GUNFIRE*
*BOOM*
The war's not over yet, U-30! Let's dive!
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
I'm not sure if it's good news or bad news...
Just tell me what's going on, Kapitän.
Well, your strategy of using the Firestorm as a lure to attract Morganas has been working since the start of our patrol...
Ja, Kapitän. I knew the Nixen would be unable to resist a lone merchant ship in the middle of the ocean. We've been able to sink so many Nixen from below with this technique!
Right - but now it seems that the Firestorm has managed to attract one of the biggest Morgana fleets that we've ever enountered on the North Sea.
We will sink them just like we sank the others, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: We're dramatically outnumbered this time.
Our ambush method is effective against a handful of Morganas, but it's not going to work against a big fleet.
We're seriously outgunned. I'm not sure if we can fight them all off.

Fields.DialogueText: Being outnumbered is no concern for a U-Boot, Kapitän - that is our normal mode of operation.
We will simply have to adjust our methods, Kapitän. There is nothing to fear.
Of course we can win, Kapitän! Don't go into a big fight with doubts like that.
I'm glad you're so confident, because this Morgana fleet is closing in fast on us and the Firestorm.
We will stand our ground and knock out any challengers that come our way, Kapitän.
Tell Captain Brenner and his crew to expect the worst. I'm not exaggerating when I say it's the biggest fleet we've seen.
Ja, Kapitän. The crew of the Firestorm is just as brave as Kapitän Brenner. I'm sure they will be okay.
I know that the Firestorm isn't a particularly quick ship, but they'll probably have to maneuver a bit more than they have been to avoid getting surrounded.
On our side, we'll just have to sink every Morgana we see as fast as we can and hope we can keep up with them.
Ja, Kapitän. Our stealth and speed can make up for our lack of numbers.
We're coming up on a small group of Morganas. Let's practice knocking these ships out as fast as we can. It's the only way we can win once that bigger fleet arrives.
Ja, Kapitän. I don't have any doubt in my belief that our savior with come through in the end!
@BATTLE
To be honest, I am really worried about this incoming fleet of Morganas, U-30. There are just so many of them - it's going to be challenging taking them all on.
We'll do our best, Kapitän - that's always worked so far.

Fields.MenuText: We've got a small fleet. I'm not sure we have the firepower to keep up with these Morganas.
U-boat tactics have always been hit-and-run. This time we'll have to stand and fight no matter what.
Protecting a big and slow merchant ship is damn near impossible with the number of Morganas coming our way.

Fields.DialogueText: We'll try to sink each one quickly and make every shot count, Kapitän.
I'm happy to trade blows, Kapitän - I did punch out a Vanity, after all.
We'll stay close to the Firestorm and shield them from the enemy, Kapitän.
I just don't know if that's going to be good enough...
It will be good enough! You're our savior, Kapitän!
You're welcome to believe all that if you want, but I need a more tangible plan...
Hmph! Why do you continue to doubt yourself, Kapitän? The Firestorm is defenseless and needs your protection!
Defenseless? Hmm... that gives me an idea...
*BOOM*
The Nixe fleet has arrived, Kapitän! We must act quickly!
@BATTLE
We took care of that first wave, but there are plenty more Morganas in this fleet.
They're more difficult than I was expecting, Kapitän. The Firestorm took a few hits. Merchant ships weren't designed to take damage in combat, and I'm worried about the munitions on board...
It's okay, U-30. It's scary to see the Firestorm smoking like that, but I've got a plan!
Wunderbar! I knew you would save us, Kapitän!

Fields.MenuText: Remember the Q-ships in the Great War?
The Firestorm has all those munitions in its hold. It's time to use them against the enemy.
I know the crew aren't trained for combat, but we need all hands on deck in this battle!

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän - you mean the merchant ships with hidden weapons that were designed to lure in submarines?
Yes, exactly!
That's an interesting idea, Kapitän...
We could use additional firepower, Kapitän, but I'm not sure what the crew of the Firestorm can do to help.
The Q-ships in the Great War were merchant ships that had hidden guns, so attacking U-boats were caught off-guard when the civilian ship they had in their sights suddenly fired back.
What we're doing with the Firestorm is only the first part - helping to lure in the Morganas. Now we need the Firestorm's help with the second part - shooting back at the Morganas to help sink them.
A good idea in theory, Kapitän, but the crew has no gunnery training or guns on board. The munitions in their hold are a mix of aerial bombs, army explosives, and artillery shells.
In short, the crew of the Firestorm cannot fight back, even if they wish to do so.
Well, we need to figure out a solution, because we need every shot to count if we're going to fight off these Morganas! Here comes another line of them--
@BATTLE
The Firestorm look some heavy damage in that last engagement, Kapitän. Kapitän Brenner is reporting fires on the deck and flooding below.
I'm amazed the munitions in her hold haven't gone off yet...
If these Nixen don't stop coming, the crew may have to dump the munitions overboard to avoid an explosion.

Fields.MenuText: Can you remind me again why we decided to use a merchant ship hauling munitions as a lure?
Throwing all that overboard would be a waste of materiel, but might save them from sinking.
It's our duty to protect the Firestorm and keep her afloat.

Fields.DialogueText: The munitions were already onboard and the Kapitän was eager to come with us on our patrol.
Ja, Kapitän - but most of the munitions on the Firestorm were destined to support armies fighting the land war. Losing them wouldn't hurt the effort against the Nixen.
Ja, Kapitän - you are our good shepherd and savior!
Hmm... you know what? I've got another idea. If the crews can't fire the munitions because they don't have guns and training, and we don't want to waste the munitions by throwing them overboard...
... why don't you just throw the munitions at the Morganas? I've been punched by you enough times to know how strong you are - throwing an aerial bomb or two shouldn't be tough.
Brilliant idea, Kapitän! We can arm the fuses, and I can just throw the bombs straight onto the decks of those Nixen! But we need to hurry before those munitions catch fire!
We've got more Morganas approaching! Let's blast our way through this line of them, then come alongside the Firestorm to pick up a bomb or two.
Jawohl, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
... Perhaps I overestimated our ability to keep the Firestorm safe.
Kapitän Brenner's crew has the fires under control, but it could get dangerous if they spread any further.
We need to hurry. Has the Firestorm's crew brought over the bombs for you yet?
They're on the way, Kapitän. The bombs are quite heavy, so it's taking the crew some time to pull them out of the cargo hold and transfer them to us.

Fields.MenuText: Once we get the bombs, we'll arm the fuses and you can lob them onto the decks of the closest Morganas.
These bombs are so big, the Morgana ships won't be able to take more than two or three hits.
How's your arm? I know you're more of a boxer than a baseball player.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän! We'll make quick work of these Nixen!
Ja, Kapitän! Even their strongest ships will have difficulty staying afloat once these bombs hit!
Baseball is a rare sport in Deutschland, Kapitän.
I must say that I'm not sure how accurate my throwing is. Football is much more popular in Deutschland than any other sport.
I don't care how these bombs get there - you can kick them at the Morganas if you want. We just need to start sinking those ships fast!
Ja, Kapitän!
Tell the crew on the Firestorm to hurry up with the bombs! We've got another line of Morganas closing in fast!
@BATTLE
Okay, we've got five 2,000 pound aerial bombs lined up and armed on the deck. Time for some free kicks, U-30!
I'll do my best, Kapitän! Here it goes...
*THWACK*
*BOOM*
You did it, U-30! Ha! You've got a golden leg to go along with your golden gloves!
The Nixe is listing in the water already, Kapitän! Your idea worked!
Don't just stand there admiring your handywork, U-30 - keep kicking those bombs over at the Morganas! We need to give the Firestorm enough time to get their fires and flooding under control.
Jawohl, Kapitän! Let's see how many more of these kicks I can land on the Nixen!
@BATTLE
You did it, U-30! You managed to sink that whole Morgana fleet thanks to that golden leg of yours!
You mean "we" did it, Kapitän. You saved us all with your quick thinking as usual.

Fields.MenuText: It was a team effort. We couldn't have done it without Captain Brenner and the Firestorm crew either.
I had doubts about your idea to involve civilians in our patrol, but we need everyone's help to win against the Morganas.
Well, I can't stop admiring those long legs of yours , U-30!

Fields.DialogueText: That is true, Kapitän. Their bravery was essential to our victory.
The Nixen will sink any ship in the ocean, so even civilians should not hesitate to fight against them, Kapitän.
U-Boote are not known for long legs, Kapitän. It's one of our less attractive qualities.
I'm just glad to have gotten through another successful patrol with you.
Ja, Kapitän! We do make a good team, don't we?
Team? I thought we were more like a couple.
We haven't had a chance to do much together besides fighting the Nixen and boxing on the deck, Kapitän. Is that what couples do?
Well, not really, now that you mention it. I supposed I could make an effort to be a little more romantic, but you're not exactly a conventional woman...
Ist das so? Human or no, I think I'm like most other girls, aren't I, Schnuffi?
... plus we have a ton of work left to do on our next patrol. We still have to sink every Morgana in the North Sea, after all.
Ooh! Now you've got my heart pounding, Kapitän - you sure know how to talk to a lady!
You're an odd one, U-30 - and I think I like it that way.
What now, Kapitän? The Firestorm has its damage under control, and can still sail under its own power. We've sunk the last of that Nixe fleet as well.
Let's chart a course back home, U-30. We've had a good patrol and sunk a lot of Morganas - I think the crew has earned themselves a little rest.
Ja, Kapitän - let's head home. This war isn't ending anytime soon...
